title: Insights
Insights
text:
Time Well Spent?
Here is what 380 hours looks like in different contexts.

You spent 15.8 full days watching Netflix this year. That is more than most people spend on vacation.


In this time, you could have cooked approximately 759 home-cooked meals. But takeout pairs better with TV anyway.


You are in the top tier of Netflix viewers. The algorithm knows you better than your family does.

title: Insights
text:
Patterns We Noticed

You are a Night Owl (10pm-6am) watcher. Most of your viewing happens during this window.


Friday is your power day. You watch more on this day than any other.


November was your streaming peak. Something about that month just hit different.


Your 36-day streak suggests you found something really good. Or really long.

title: Insights
section: What Your Data Says About You
text:
What Your Data Says About You
Based on your viewing habits, here are some observations:

You tend to commit to shows you start. Once you are in, you are ALL in.


You are a power binger. Cliffhangers do not stand a chance against you.


Night owl energy. The best content comes out when the world is quiet.

title: Insights
text:
Final Thoughts
You spent 380 hours streaming this year. That is:

Stories that made you laugh
Plot twists that kept you up way too late

Characters you grew attached to
Worlds you escaped into

Not a single hour wasted.


Same time next year?

title: About
text:
This project creates a personalized “Year in Review” summary of your Netflix viewing habits, similar to end-of-year recaps from various streaming services.



Download your Netflix data from your account settings
Run the processing script to analyze your viewing history
View your personalized Recap with stats, insights, and fun facts





Go to Netflix.com and sign in
Click your profile icon > Account
Scroll down to Security & Privacy
Click Download your personal information
Select Viewing Activity (or download all)
Wait for the email from Netflix (can take up to 30 days)
Download and extract the ZIP file
Find ViewingActivity.csv and place it in the data/ folder





All data processing happens locally on your machine
No data is sent to any external servers
Your viewing history stays private





Python - Data processing and analysis
Quarto - Static site generation
GitHub Pages - Free hosting




This project is open source. Feel free to fork it and create your own Recap!
View on GitHub

Created with data, coffee, and a love for good television.

Select Viewing Activity (or download all)
Wait for the email from Netflix (can take up to 30 days)
Download and extract the ZIP file
Find ViewingActivity.csv and place it in the data/ folder
